item.title: A Very Personal Message
item.author: Sharad Gupta
item.description:
I’m passionate about helping the elderly through Bay Area Older Adults.
I was born and raised in India, where ancient traditions seamlessly mingle with modern-day city life. A core value in Indian culture is the respect we afford to our seniors who are responsible for inculcating the ancient traditions and sharing their wisdom with our youth.
Living as joint families, caregiving is part and parcel of our culture. According to our religious beliefs, a child who cares for their grandparents is blessed and considered ikpunar, or the accumulation of good karma.
I’m blessed with a wonderful life here in California and I’m well aware of the sacrifices my parents and grandparents made to make this life a reality. My memories are vivid of my grandfather carrying me with him and helping me to learn how to ride my first bicycle or with my childhood science projects.
While the passage of time has taken my grandparents away from me, I pay it forward by supporting Bay Area Older Adults. In the Bay Area, many seniors live alone, one in three have some form of vision loss, and more than 40% of elders age 65 to 84 are widowed. These physical challenges and emotional distress lead to social isolation and detrimental health effects.
“Referrals are the lifeblood of our business.”
Social support is one of the most important contributors to a higher quality of life, health, and wellness for seniors. This is why Bay Area Older Adults focuses on improving their social well-being.
This year, we are on a mission to raise $50,000 for Bay Area Older Adults. A portion of our fees from every sale goes toward the cause. You can help us achieve these goals by providing us referrals for your family, friends, or neighbors who may be interested in buying, selling, or investing in real estate. We need your help because referrals are the lifeblood of our business.
Only with your help can we keep building the business and consistently provide the level of service that ensures our clients are always completely satisfied. We sincerely hope you will tell your friends, family, neighbors, and coworkers about our worthy cause the next time they’re considering a move. Not only will they get the award-winning service that we are known for, but also a solid portion of our income will go toward a very worthy cause. I invite you to visit our website, where you can check out the great work they are doing in our community.
If you have any other real estate questions for me, don’t hesitate to reach out via phone or email. I look forward to hearing from you.
item.itunes:subtitle: I’m passionate about helping the elderly through Bay Area Older Adults.
item.itunes:author: Sharad Gupta
item.itunes:summary: I’m passionate about helping the elderly through Bay Area Older Adults.

item.title: Q: What’s the Current State of Our Market?
item.author: Sharad Gupta
item.description:
Here’s what you need to know about our market as we enter summer.
The economy and housing market continue to see signs of improvement, particularly in terms of buyer demand. The labor market impact continues to shrink, but mortgage applications and showing appointments keep improving, and there are three reasons why:
1. Mortgage interest rates are at an all-time low. For a 30-year fixed rate mortgage, we’re seeing an average rate of 3.5%. It’s never been so affordable to borrow money and invest in homeownership.
2. Buyer demand is coming back. After declining by nearly 75% compared to the start of the year, the number of showings booked through Showingtime.com has increased by 0.3% compared to this point in 2019. In other words, showings have increased by more than 50% on a weekly basis since the start of 2020, and they’re 13.2% higher than late February’s pre-crisis levels.
“Mortgage applications and showing appointments keep improving.”
3. Supply response is not matching the uptick in demand. One reason the forecast calls for a slow trajectory for closed sales is that new supply is not rebounding to the same degree as buyer demand. Pending sales are only down slightly, while the pace of new listings coming back to the market has been essentially flat. Even as the economy reopens and buyer demand returns, new supply is desperately needed in order to maintain an upward trend of pending sales so that closed transactions can continue to rise.
If you’d like to talk more about what’s happening in our market, or if you have any questions, don’t hesitate to reach out to me. I’d love to help.
item.itunes:subtitle: Here’s what you need to know about our market as we enter summer.
item.itunes:author: Sharad Gupta
item.itunes:summary: Here’s what you need to know about our market as we enter summer.

item.title: Welcome to My Blog
item.author: Sharad Gupta
item.description:
As a real estate professional, I know what’s happening every day in the Bay Area, specifically concerning home values and how these trends and developments will directly affect you. Even as this ongoing pandemic is changing our market, I’m out on the front lines to make sure that those changes are communicated to you.
Therefore, I plan to post two helpful messages each month on this blog to keep you updated and help you stay on top of what’s happening in the community.
Thank you for taking the time to read this.
Even though the way we buy and sell homes is changing, I’m going to be here to help you through it. Let us know if you have any questions.
Check back because content will be coming soon!
I’m determined to keep you updated on what’s going on with the real estate market.
item.itunes:subtitle: My monthly messages will provide you with market updates, tips, and other educational information having to do with our market.
item.itunes:author: Sharad Gupta
item.itunes:summary: My monthly messages will provide you with market updates, tips, and other educational information having to do with our market.
